title: Boris Johnson
added: Johnson's government has been placing great importance on seeking a "[[Special Relationship]]" with the [[Trump administation]]. Commentators have questioned how the ties between Johnson and Trump will impact the United Kingdom's relationship with the United States during the [[Joe Biden]] presidency.<ref>https://www.politico.com/news/2019/12/12/trump-boris-johnson-relationship-083732</ref><ref>https://www.cityam.com/can-boris-johnson-forge-a-special-relationship-with-joe-biden/</ref><ref>https://edition.cnn.com/2020/10/17/politics/special-relationship-election-analysis-gbr-intl/index.html</ref><ref>https://www.eveningexpress.co.uk/news/uk/biden-presidency-could-bring-difficulties-for-us-uk-special-relationship/</ref><ref>https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2020/01/07/special-relationship-hangs-balance-boris-johnson-cant-afford/</ref>

title: Boris Johnson
added: Johnson's government has been placing great importance on seeking a "[[Special Relationship]]" with the [[Trumpadministration]]. title: Boris Johnson
added: Johnson's government has been placing great importance on seeking a "[[Special Relationship]]" with the [[Trump administration]]. Commentators have questioned how the ties between Johnson and Trump will impact the United Kingdom's relationship with the United States during the [[Joe Biden]] presidency.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2019/12/12/trump-boris-johnson-relationship-083732|title=Boris and Donald: A very special relationship|website=POLITICO}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cityam.com/can-boris-johnson-forge-a-special-relationship-with-joe-biden/|title=Can Boris Johnson forge a special relationship with Joe Biden?|date=29 October 2020|website=CityAM}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/17/politics/special-relationship-election-analysis-gbr-intl/index.html|title=UK's 'special relationship' with the US is more fragile than ever. Just when Boris Johnson is banking on it|first=Analysis by Luke McGee|last=CNN|website=CNN}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eveningexpress.co.uk/news/uk/biden-presidency-could-bring-difficulties-for-us-uk-special-relationship/|title=Biden presidency could bring difficulties for US-UK special relationship|first=Press|last=Association|date=7 November 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2020/01/07/special-relationship-hangs-balance-boris-johnson-cant-afford/|title=As the Special Relationship hangs in the balance, Boris Johnson can't afford to stay neutral on Iran|first=Benedict|last=Spence|date=7 January 2020|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}}</ref>

title: Boris Johnson
deleted: In September 2020,  [[Bob Kerslake|Lord Kerslake]] (chair of the [[UK2070 Commission]] which deals with the [[North–South divide in England|English North–South divide]]) announced that plans for further [[Devolution in the United Kingdom|devolution]] were put on hold until 2021, with a white paper on the issue placing less emphasis on devolution.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bounds |first1=Andy |last2=Pickard |first2=Jim |last3=Thomas |first3=Daniel |title=Plans for further English devolution shelved until next year |url=https://www.ft.com/content/e1e2c392-a2e6-4ac5-9f0e-51e2926b1785 |access-date=24 November 2020 |work=Financial Times |date=30 September 2020}}</ref> During the pandemic, Greater Manchester mayor [[Andy Burnham]] and regional leaders in [[Greater Manchester]] unanimously opposed being placed into the highest category (Tier 3) of the government system for localised COVID-19 lockdown restrictions, and begun a bitter row with the Westminster government;<ref>{{cite news |title=Coronavirus: Greater Manchester leaders fuming as they 'unanimously reject' Tier 3 plan |url=https://news.sky.com/story/coronavirus-greater-manchester-being-used-by-government-as-sacrificial-lamb-claims-andy-burnham-12104944 |access-date=24 November 2020 |work=Sky News |date=15 October 2020 |language=en}}</ref> this impacted the decisions taken by Johnson's government, and reinforced support for English devolution.<ref>{{cite news |title=Andy Burnham strengthens the case for devolution in Britain |url=https://www.economist.com/britain/2020/09/26/andy-burnham-strengthens-the-case-for-devolution-in-britain |access-date=24 November 2020 |work=The Economist |date=26 September 2020}}</ref> In Scotland, although some Conservatives think Johnson should take a hardline approach with the [[Scottish National Party]], intervening previously-considered devolved matters in Scotland, a joint governmental review of workings between the UK government and the Scottish, Welsh and Northern Irish administrations argued for a more co-operative approach, as well as a report compiled by Conservative peer [[Andrew Dunlop, Baron Dunlop|Lord Dunlop]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Allardyce |first1=Jason |title=Boris Johnson must be less muscular over unionism, says former UK Tory minister |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/boris-johnson-must-be-less-muscular-over-unionism-says-former-uk-tory-minister-wxxlpk63k |access-date=24 November 2020 |work=The Sunday Times |date=1 November 2020 |language=en}}</ref>

title: Boris Johnson
deleted: Boris' paternal grandmother, Yvonne Eileen Irene Williams (1907-1987) was a great-great-granddaughter of [[Prince Paul of Württemberg]], making Johnson a direct descendant of [[George II of Great Britain]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=BBC - Press Office - Boris Johnson's Royal ancestry revealed|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/pressreleases/stories/2008/08_august/04/think.shtml|access-date=2020-11-06|website=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref> He was confirmed in the Anglican faith while attending Eton College.<ref>{{cite work|date=27 July 2019|title=Boris Johnson's confusing and contradictory religious history|url=https://www.economist.com/erasmus/2019/07/27/boris-johnsons-confusing-and-contradictory-religious-history|work=[[The Economist]]|access-date=18 October 2020|url-access=subscription}}</ref>
